newsitem.title: FINLAND: PARTEK TAKES MAJORITY IN LITHUANIAN FIRM.
newsitem.headline: PARTEK TAKES MAJORITY IN LITHUANIAN FIRM.

text.p: Finnish building materials and cargo handling equipment group Partek said on Friday it had raised its stake in Lithuanian insulation maker UAB Paroc Silikatas to 70 percent from 48 percent for an undisclosed sum.
"Partek Insulation has aquired the 22 percent holding of the local partner, AB Silikatas," it said adding that Silikatas wanted to focus on its core businesses.

In a separate deal, Partek Insulation had sold its greenhouse rock-wool unit Pargo which has annual net sales of about 13 million markka to Danish company Grodania, and the unit would focus on its core business the Baltic region, Partek said.
Partek did not give the value of the disposal.
It said Partek Insulation was a market leader in rock-wool based insulation in Finland, Sweden and the Baltic.
